lines.text: Oh, games are important. They prepare a boy for the larger game of life, I'm told.
The only thing is, now that I'm going to be an Earl, I can't become a Democrat and become President - which is what Mr. Hobbs had in mind for me.
President? You will go to the House of Lords.
Is that just as good as being President?
Poor child, infinitely superior.
Tell the lady that like all Americans she is exceedingly rude.
Tell his Lordship it is obvious Americans do not have a monopoly on rudeness.
Tell the lady she offends me.
Tell his Lordship I certainly hope so.
Bring the woman here, and her spawn.
I'm learning how to talk French. It's pretty tricky.
I'll be jiggered.
I'm jiggered too, Mr. Hobbs.
We have a philanthropist in our midst. One who bestows largesse on bootblacks and grocers.
My boy is your right and proper heir and I want what's comin' to me.
What's comin' to you is the back of my hand.
I'll have no graspin' tyrant sittin' on my barrels.
You call it maturity, the Yanks call it precosity, and I call it impudence.

[reading a letter from Ceddie aloud to Dick]
"I miss you and Dick. There's a dungeon under the castle but my grandpa never put anyone in there."
[sarcastically]
Oh yeah? "Your old friend, Ceddie Lord Fauntleroy. P.S. - I have to sign it that way."
